alert.note: Alert for Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 6:28AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Perry. In Kentucky, Breckinridge and Hancock. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tell City, Hawesville, Lewisport, Cannelton, Cloverport, Dukes, Sunny Corner, Skillman, Chambers and Goering. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
